bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Thomas P. Overnall. Warant
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States of America Territory of Washington County of Jefferson
To the sheriff of the County of Jefferson W.T.

Greetings: In the name of the United States you are herby commanded to arrest T. Nelson Overnall, a male child about fourteen months old, if he be found in your coustody, who is said to be in the custody of one Thomas P. Overnall of said County and to bring said child forthwith before the Hon. CC. Hewitt, district Judge at Chambers, in Port Townsend W. T. to the end that inqiry May be made into into the nature and cause of his alleged restraint or if in your opinion it should seem improper to bring said child to said place, on account of his tender age, there to deliver him forthwith to his mother in said county, who is the wife of said Thomas P. Overnall, There to remain until further orders
in the premises. and of this warant make due return forthwith
Witness the Hon. CC Hewitt, judge of the district court of the 3d jud. District W.T. A Port Townsend W.T. this 28th day of Oct. 1862, and the year of the dictrict court of Port Townsend.
Clerk Dist court of Port Townsend
Served the within by arresting the child within named and plasing it in the possition of its mother This the 28th of Oct 1862 - G.P. Knight sheriff of Island Co. W. T.
served the writ of habeas corpus by leaving the same with Thos P. Overnall in Island Co W. T. This Oct the 28th- 1862- J.P. Knight Sheriff of Island Co W. T.
Territory of Washington 3d Jud. District- County of Jefferson
